revised_title: Properties and Decay Modes of Unstable Particles and Charged Particles
tldr: The article discusses the properties and decay modes of unstable particles and charged particles, focusing on the -particles and -particles discovered using the Wilson cloud chamber. The author compares the properties of these particles with those of -particles found in photographic emulsions and provides a provisional interpretation of the data. The study includes the lifetimes, masses, and decay processes of these particles, as well as the nature of the neutral secondaries produced by their decay.
